definition.en: to copy someone’s actions or take guidance from what they do; to do something because someone else did it first
definition.zh: 以某人的做法为榜样；照着某人的提示/带头去做

examples.en: When the manager stayed calm, the whole team followed his cue from him and kept working.
examples.zh: 经理保持冷静时，整个团队就以他为榜样，也继续稳住情绪工作。

examples.en: She followed her cue from her older sister and applied for the same scholarship.
examples.zh: 她照着姐姐的做法，也申请了同一个奖学金。

examples.en: Seeing everyone wear masks, I followed my cue from them and put one on too.
examples.zh: 看到大家都戴口罩，我就照着他们也戴上了。

extraExplanation: 常见结构：follow one’s cue from + 人（更强调“从某人那里得到行动信号/榜样”）。也常说 follow someone’s cue（不加 from），意思相同，更常用。
etymology: 源自“cue”（提示、信号），在戏剧里指演员根据提示上场或说台词；后来引申为“根据别人给出的信号/做法来行动”。
mnemonic: cue = “提示/暗号”。想象演戏时演员“看提示就行动”，所以 follow one’s cue from someone = “看某人给的暗号/做法照着做”。
联想中文“照葫芦画瓢”：看到别人怎么做，你就怎么做。

summary.en: pursue your ideal goal in life
summary.zh: 追逐人生理想与目标

definition.en: to pursue the goal or life you truly want, even if it is difficult or different from what others expect
definition.zh: 追随/追逐自己的梦想（坚持做自己真正想做的事，即使很难或不被他人理解）

examples.en: She left a stable job to follow her dream of becoming a photographer.
examples.zh: 她辞掉了稳定的工作，去追随自己成为摄影师的梦想。

examples.en: It takes courage to follow your dreams when people doubt you.
examples.zh: 当别人怀疑你时，追逐梦想需要勇气。

examples.en: He moved to New York to follow his dream.
examples.zh: 他搬到纽约去追梦。

extraExplanation: 用法提示：one’s 要随人称变化：follow my/your/his/her/our/their dream(s)。更常见的是复数 follow your dreams（追逐你的梦想），强调可能有多个目标或人生方向。
语气与搭配：多用于鼓励、演讲、励志语境；也可更中性地描述人生选择。常见替换说法：pursue your dream(s)、chase your dream(s)（更口语、更强调“追赶”）。
文化语境：在美国文化中，这个短语常与“American Dream（美国梦）”的价值观联系在一起，强调个人选择、机会与自我实现。
etymology: 这是一个现代英语中的常用表达：follow（跟随、追随）+ one’s dream（某人的梦想）。dream 源自古英语，原义与“欢乐、音乐、幻象/梦境”相关，后来逐渐固定为“睡梦/梦想”的意思；在此处是比喻用法，指人生目标与理想。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow=跟着；dream=梦想 → “跟着梦想走”。
联想中文“追梦”：follow（跟随）+ dream（梦）≈ 追梦。

summary.en: copy someone’s behavior as a model
summary.zh: 照着某人的榜样去做；效仿某人的做法

definition.en: to do what someone else does or to behave in the same way, because you think it is a good model to copy
definition.zh: 效仿某人的做法；以某人为榜样照着做

examples.en: I decided to follow my sister’s example and apply for a scholarship.
examples.zh: 我决定效仿姐姐的做法，申请奖学金。

examples.en: If we follow her example, we’ll apologize first and try to fix the problem.
examples.zh: 如果我们以她为榜样，我们会先道歉，再想办法解决问题。

examples.en: Many young athletes try to follow their coach’s example in training every day.
examples.zh: 很多年轻运动员努力在每天训练中效仿教练的做法。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow someone’s example（效仿某人）；set an example（树立榜样）；lead by example（以身作则）。
语气通常偏中性或褒义：多用于“学好的做法”。若要表达“学坏的”，常加限定：follow his bad example（效仿他的坏榜样）。
one’s 会随人称变化：follow my/your/his/her/their example。
etymology: 该短语由 follow（跟随）+ one’s（某人的）+ example（榜样/范例）组成，字面是“跟随某人的范例”，引申为“模仿其行为与选择”。
mnemonic: 把它按字面记：follow=跟着走，example=例子/榜样 → “跟着别人的例子走”=效仿。
联想中文固定说法“以某人为榜样”：example=榜样，follow=照做。

summary.en: Act according to your true feelings and values.
summary.zh: 按真实感受与价值观行事。

definition.en: To do what you truly want or feel is right, guided by your own feelings and values rather than pressure from others.
definition.zh: 追随内心；按自己的真实感受和价值观去做，而不是被他人或外界压力左右。

examples.en: Everyone wanted her to take a stable job, but she decided to follow her heart and become a photographer.
examples.zh: 大家都希望她找一份稳定的工作，但她决定追随内心，去当摄影师。

examples.en: If you follow your heart, you may feel scared at first, but you’ll regret it less later.
examples.zh: 如果你追随内心，一开始可能会害怕，但以后更不容易后悔。

examples.en: He followed his heart and apologized, even though it was uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 他追随内心道了歉，尽管这让他很不舒服。

extraExplanation: 语气通常是积极鼓励的，但不等于“冲动行事”。更自然的理解是：在理性考虑之后，仍选择与自己价值观一致的道路。
常见搭配：follow your heart；listen to your heart（倾听内心）；trust your gut（相信直觉，语气更偏直觉而非价值观）。
文化语境中常用于人生选择（专业、工作、爱情），类似中文“听从内心/随心而行”，但英语里常带“忠于自我”的色彩。
etymology: 这是一个英语习语：heart 常用来象征“情感、良知、内心的真实愿望”。follow 在这里是“跟随、听从”的比喻用法，合起来就是“听从内心的指引”。
mnemonic: 把 heart 想成“心/内心”；follow=“跟着走”：跟着心走→追随内心。
联想中文“从心而动”：做决定时先问自己“我真正想要什么？”再 follow。

summary.en: copy or act according to someone’s guidance
summary.zh: 按某人的指引行事；效仿某人

definition.en: to do what someone else does or to act according to someone else’s example or guidance
definition.zh: 跟随某人的带领；效仿某人的做法

examples.en: I’m new here, so I’ll just follow your lead.
examples.zh: 我刚来这里，所以我就跟着你做。

examples.en: When she started clapping, the rest of the audience followed her lead.
examples.zh: 她开始鼓掌后，其他观众也跟着鼓掌了。

examples.en: In emergencies, follow the staff’s lead and stay calm.
examples.zh: 遇到紧急情况时，听从工作人员指挥并保持冷静。

extraExplanation: 常见结构：follow someone’s lead（后面接人），也可说 follow the lead of someone/something（更正式）。
语气通常中性：既可以表示“向有经验的人学习”，也可能含有“别人怎么做我就怎么做”的意味，具体看语境。
etymology: 源自 lead 的名词用法，原意是“带路/引导的动作或方向”（像猎犬循着“线索/气味轨迹”或人走在前面带路）。后来引申为“以某人为榜样或听从其指引”。
mnemonic: 把 lead 想成“领路的人/领头的动作”，follow one’s lead 就是“跟着TA的脚步走”。
联想中文：跟着“领头羊”的路走——“跟着TA带头做”。

summary.en: Go straight ahead or trust your instinct.
summary.zh: 一直往前走；或凭直觉行事。

definition.en: To go straight ahead, guided by what seems obvious; or to rely on your instincts when deciding what to do.
definition.zh: 一直往前走（按最明显的方向）；或凭直觉行事、顺着感觉做决定。

examples.en: To get to the station, just follow your nose—you can’t miss it.
examples.zh: 去车站的话就一直往前走就行，你不可能找不到。

examples.en: I didn’t have a plan for the trip; I just followed my nose and explored the city.
examples.zh: 我旅行没有具体计划；我就凭直觉在城里到处逛。

examples.en: When choosing a gift, she followed her nose and picked something simple but thoughtful.
examples.zh: 挑礼物时，她凭直觉选了一个简单但很贴心的东西。

extraExplanation: 常用于非正式口语。第一种意思多用于问路/指路：强调路线很简单、基本不需要拐弯或复杂说明。
第二种意思强调“凭感觉/凭直觉”，语气通常较轻松，不一定表示冲动，也可以是经验带来的判断。
etymology: 源自字面意思“跟着鼻子走”：鼻子在脸的最前面，所以“跟着鼻子”可以理解为一直直走；也引申为像嗅觉一样依靠本能来判断方向或做决定。
mnemonic: 把鼻子想成“导航箭头”：鼻子朝哪儿，就往哪儿走＝一直向前。
联想“闻味道找路”：像小狗一样靠嗅觉本能判断方向＝凭直觉做决定。

summary.en: to monitor someone’s development over time
summary.zh: 跟踪某人的进展与成长

definition.en: To watch, track, or monitor how someone improves or advances over time.
definition.zh: 关注、跟踪某人随着时间推移的进步与发展。

examples.en: Teachers follow each student’s progress throughout the semester.
examples.zh: 老师会在整个学期跟踪每位学生的学习进度。

examples.en: The doctor will follow your progress after the surgery.
examples.zh: 手术后医生会持续观察你的恢复情况。

examples.en: Her mentor followed her progress and gave helpful feedback.
examples.zh: 她的导师一直关注她的进步并给予有用的反馈。

etymology: 短语由 follow（跟随、追踪）+ one’s（某人的）+ progress（进步、进展）组成，字面意思是“跟随某人的进展”，引申为“持续监测/了解其变化与提升”。常用于教育、医疗、训练、工作绩效等场景。
mnemonic: 把它想成“跟着（follow）进度条（progress）走”，随时看对方走到哪一步。
progress 可联想到“进步/进度”，follow 则是“追踪”，合起来就是“追踪进步”。

summary.en: Requesting the term to look up.
summary.zh: 请求提供要查询的词语。

definition.en: Please tell me the word or phrase you want to look up (e.g., “resilient” or “break the ice”).
definition.zh: 请告诉我你想查询的单词或短语（例如“resilient”或“break the ice”）。

examples.en: Which word would you like to learn today?
examples.zh: 你今天想学哪个词？

examples.en: Send me a word or idiom, and I’ll explain it with meanings, examples, and memory tips.
examples.zh: 发给我一个单词或习语，我会用释义、例句和记忆方法来讲解。

etymology: 请提供要查询的词/短语后，我会补充词源信息。

summary.en: obey the agreed rules; also, act within the accepted system in real life
summary.zh: 遵守规则；也指在现实情境中按既定体系/惯例行事

definition.en: to obey and act according to the agreed rules in a sport, activity, or competition
definition.zh: 遵守（运动、活动或比赛中）约定的规则

examples.en: If you want to play, you have to follow the rules of the game.
examples.zh: 如果你想玩/参赛，就必须遵守游戏规则。

examples.en: The referee reminded both teams to follow the rules of the game.
examples.zh: 裁判提醒两队要遵守比赛规则。

definition.en: (figurative) to accept and operate within the usual system, expectations, or ‘unwritten rules’ in a situation (often business, politics, or social life)
definition.zh: （比喻）按“游戏规则”办事：接受并在某个体系/环境的常规（含潜规则）内行事

examples.en: In this industry, you need to follow the rules of the game to succeed.
examples.zh: 在这个行业里，要想成功就得按这套“游戏规则”来。

examples.en: She doesn’t like office politics, but she knows she must follow the rules of the game.
examples.zh: 她不喜欢办公室政治，但也知道不得不按这里的“游戏规则”行事。

examples.en: We can push for change, but we still have to follow the rules of the game.
examples.zh: 我们可以推动改变，但仍得在规则之内行动。

extraExplanation: 更自然的说法通常是：follow the rules of the game / follow the rules of the game(s)。如果强调某项具体比赛，用the game；如果泛指各种比赛或多轮赛事，可用games。
语气提示：在比喻用法里，这个表达有时带一点无奈或现实意味，暗示“即使不喜欢，也得按这套规则来”。
etymology: 源自字面意思“遵守比赛/游戏的规则（rules of the game）”。后来在英语中常被引申为“按某个领域的规则与惯例行事”，尤其用于商业、职场与政治语境。
mnemonic: 把它想成“进场玩就要守规矩”：follow（跟着）+ rules（规则）+ game（游戏）。
联想中文“按游戏规则来/照章办事”，意思几乎一一对应。

summary.en: go after, obey, keep up with, or understand someone
summary.zh: 跟随、听从、关注或理解某人

definition.en: to go or come after someone; to move behind them in the same direction
definition.zh: 跟随某人；跟在某人后面走（同一方向）

examples.en: Please follow me to the office.
examples.zh: 请跟我到办公室去。

examples.en: A child followed his mother into the store.
examples.zh: 一个孩子跟着妈妈走进了商店。

examples.en: I saw someone following us, so we changed streets.
examples.zh: 我看到有人跟着我们，所以我们换了条街。

definition.en: to obey someone’s instructions or guidance
definition.zh: 听从某人的指示；按某人的指导去做

examples.en: Follow your doctor’s advice and rest for a week.
examples.zh: 听从医生的建议，休息一周。

examples.en: If you follow the teacher, you’ll understand the problem.
examples.zh: 如果你听老师的讲解，你就会理解这个问题。

definition.en: to pay attention to someone’s work or updates regularly (online or in media)
definition.zh: （在社交媒体/媒体上）关注某人；持续看某人的动态

examples.en: I follow her on Instagram for cooking ideas.
examples.zh: 我在Instagram上关注她，获取做饭灵感。

examples.en: Many fans follow the singer’s news closely.
examples.zh: 很多粉丝密切关注这位歌手的消息。

definition.en: to understand what someone says or means
definition.zh: 听懂；理解某人的意思

examples.en: Sorry, I don’t quite follow you.
examples.zh: 抱歉，我没太听懂你的意思。

examples.en: Do you follow what I’m saying?
examples.zh: 你明白我在说什么吗？

extraExplanation: “follow sb.” 里的 sb. 是 somebody 的缩写，常见于词典/笔记中；写作时一般写成 follow someone / follow him / follow her。
注意区分：follow sb.（跟随某人） vs. follow up（跟进） vs. follow through（坚持做完）。
在“有人跟着你”的语境里，follow 可能带紧张/危险含义；更正式也可说 be followed by / be tracked.
etymology: 源自古英语 folgian（跟随、追随）。后来含义扩展到“遵从（建议/规则）”和“理解（论点）”，现代又常用于“关注（社交媒体）”。
mnemonic: 把 follow 想成“后(fo-)面(-llow)”：人走在前，你在后面跟着。
联想中文“追随/跟随”：follow = 跟；follow sb. = 跟某人。

summary.en: do what someone recommends
summary.zh: 按他人建议去做

definition.en: to do what someone suggests or recommends
definition.zh: 听从某人的建议；照某人的建议去做

examples.en: You should follow your doctor’s advice and get more rest.
examples.zh: 你应该听从医生的建议，多休息。

examples.en: I didn’t follow her advice, and I regretted it later.
examples.zh: 我没有听她的建议，后来我后悔了。

examples.en: If you follow his advice, you’ll avoid a lot of trouble.
examples.zh: 如果你照他的建议去做，你会避免很多麻烦。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow sb.’s advice / follow the advice of sb.（较正式）。
易混点：advice（不可数名词） vs. advise（动词）。例如：He gave me some advice. / He advised me to rest.
也可用更口语的说法：take sb.’s advice（采纳某人的建议）。
etymology: “follow”本义是“跟随”，引申为“遵从（规则/指示/建议）”；“advice”来自法语/拉丁语词根，表示“意见、劝告”。合起来就是“按建议去做”。
mnemonic: 把 follow 想成“跟着走”，advice 想成“建议”：跟着建议走＝听从建议。
联想短语：follow the rules（遵守规则）→ follow advice（遵从建议），用同一个 follow 记住“遵从”的用法。

summary.en: to imitate someone’s life path or career
summary.zh: 效仿某人的人生道路或职业选择

definition.en: to do the same job, take the same path, or live in a similar way as someone (often an older family member or role model)
definition.zh: 追随某人的脚步；步某人后尘（常指跟随长辈/榜样走相似的道路或从事同样的事业）

examples.en: She followed her father’s footsteps and became a doctor.
examples.zh: 她追随父亲的脚步，成了一名医生。

examples.en: Many young players hope to follow his footsteps one day.
examples.zh: 许多年轻球员希望有一天能追随他的脚步。

examples.en: After graduating, he decided not to follow his sister’s footsteps.
examples.zh: 毕业后，他决定不走姐姐的路。

extraExplanation: 常用搭配：follow in someone’s footsteps（更常见，意思相同）；follow someone’s lead（跟随某人带头做的事，更强调“照着做”而不一定是同一职业道路）。
语法点：sb. = somebody（某人）；footsteps 通常用复数。人称所有格要一致：follow his/her/their footsteps。
语气与场景：多用于正面或中性语境（敬佩、传承、仰慕），也可用于表示“被期待/被要求”去延续某条道路。
etymology: 源自直译性的比喻：footsteps（脚印、脚步）象征“走过的路/经历”。follow someone’s footsteps 字面是“沿着某人的脚印走”，引申为“效仿、追随”。
mnemonic: 把它想成“沿着某人的脚印走”：脚印都在地上，走同一条路就很自然会“follow”。
foot + steps = “脚 + 步”，联想到中文“步…后尘/追随…脚步”。

summary.en: obey or carry out someone’s directions
summary.zh: 遵照某人的指示去做

definition.en: to do what someone tells you to do; to carry out someone’s directions or guidance
definition.zh: 按照某人的指示去做；遵照某人的指导执行

examples.en: Please follow the teacher’s instructions during the lab.
examples.zh: 做实验时请遵照老师的指示。

examples.en: If you follow my instructions carefully, the computer should start normally.
examples.zh: 如果你仔细照我说的步骤做，电脑应该能正常启动。

examples.en: He didn’t follow the doctor’s instructions, so his recovery was slower.
examples.zh: 他没有遵照医生的嘱咐，所以恢复得更慢。

extraExplanation: “instruction(s)”作“指示/说明”时通常用复数，尤其是指一系列步骤（如说明书、考试规则、操作步骤）。
常见搭配：follow instructions / follow the instructions / follow someone’s instructions；反义表达常用：ignore instructions（无视指示）。
etymology: “follow”源自古英语，原意有“跟随、追随”，后来也引申为“遵从（规则/建议/指示）”。“instructions”来自拉丁语词根，含“教导、指令”的意思；合起来常用于日常与正式语境，表示“照指示执行”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow = 跟着走；instructions = 指令/步骤。合起来就是“跟着（某人的）步骤走”。
联想场景：装家具/做菜/做实验——只要“照说明一步步来”，就是在 follow instructions。

summary.en: behave according to accepted social rules and expectations
summary.zh: 按社会公认的规则与期待行事

definition.en: to behave in a way that matches the accepted rules, customs, and expectations of a society or group
definition.zh: 遵守社会规范；按群体公认的规则、习俗和期待行事

examples.en: In many workplaces, people follow social norms like arriving on time and speaking politely.
examples.zh: 在许多职场里，人们会遵守社会规范，比如准时到达和礼貌表达。

examples.en: He tried to follow social norms at the dinner party, even though he felt nervous.
examples.zh: 他在晚宴上努力遵守社交礼仪，尽管他感到紧张。

examples.en: Teenagers may not always follow social norms because they want to show independence.
examples.zh: 青少年不一定总是遵守社会规范，因为他们想表现独立。

extraExplanation: “social norms”指不成文的规则（大家默认的做法），不一定写在法律里；不遵守通常不会被“处罚”，但可能会引来他人不满、尴尬或被排斥。
不同文化的社会规范差异很大：比如排队距离、直视对方的程度、称呼方式、送礼或拒绝的表达等。跨文化交流时，可以用更中性的礼貌表达来降低误会。
etymology: “follow”来自古英语，原意含“跟随、遵从”；“norm”来自拉丁语 norma（“标准、准则”，本义与“木匠用的直角规”有关），后来引申为“社会标准/规范”。整体搭配表示“遵从群体的标准行为”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow＝“跟着做/照着来”，social norms＝“社会的规矩”；合起来就是“照着社会规矩来”。
联想中文常说的“入乡随俗”：到一个群体/环境里，就“follow social norms”。

summary.en: Behave in ways that are socially acceptable and expected.
summary.zh: 按社会认可与期待的方式行事。

definition.en: To behave according to a society’s accepted norms and manners (what is considered polite, appropriate, or expected).
definition.zh: 遵守社会规范与礼仪（做被认为礼貌、合适、符合期待的行为）。

examples.en: In a new country, it helps to follow social rules about greetings and personal space.
examples.zh: 在一个新国家，遵守关于打招呼和个人空间的社会规范会很有帮助。

examples.en: Even if you disagree, you may need to follow social rules at work to stay professional.
examples.zh: 即使你不同意，在工作场合你也可能需要遵守社会规则来保持专业。

examples.en: Some teenagers struggle to follow social rules in formal events like weddings.
examples.zh: 有些青少年在婚礼等正式场合不太会遵守社交礼仪。

extraExplanation: “social rules”常常是“不成文规则”（unwritten rules），比如排队、轮流发言、用什么称呼、是否给小费等；不同文化差异很大。
在更正式或学术的语境中，也可用“social norms”（社会规范）来表达类似含义。
etymology: 这是由动词短语“follow”（跟随、遵从）+ 名词短语“social rules”（社会规则/规范）构成的常见表达，不是固定成语，但在日常与职场语境中很常用。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow=“跟着做/照着做”，social rules=“社交规则”。合起来就是“照着社交规则来做”。
联想中文“入乡随俗”：到一个新环境，就要“follow social rules”。

summary.en: imitate a person’s good behavior or model
summary.zh: 效仿某人的榜样做法

definition.en: to do the same thing as someone else because you think their behavior is good or correct; to imitate someone’s behavior
definition.zh: 以某人为榜样，照着某人的做法去做；效仿某人的行为

examples.en: She followed her mother’s example and became a nurse.
examples.zh: 她以母亲为榜样，也成了一名护士。

examples.en: If you want your kids to read more, follow your teacher’s example and read every day.
examples.zh: 如果你想让孩子多读书，就以你老师为榜样，每天阅读。

examples.en: Many young athletes try to follow his example in training and discipline.
examples.zh: 很多年轻运动员在训练和自律方面都想效仿他的做法。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow someone’s example / set an example（树立榜样）/ lead by example（以身作则）。
语气通常偏正面，表示“学好的一面”。如果要表达“学坏”，更常说 follow in someone’s footsteps（追随某人的脚步，未必好坏）或 copy someone（更口语）。
etymology: 来自短语“follow (someone’s) example”。example 源自拉丁语 exemplum，意为“样本、典范”；follow 表示“跟随、遵循”。合起来就是“遵循某人的典范”。
mnemonic: 把 example 记成“例子/榜样”，follow = “跟着走” → “跟着榜样走”。
联想中文固定说法“以……为榜样”，几乎是一一对应。

summary.en: do the same as someone else or accept their guidance
summary.zh: 跟随某人的带领或做法；效仿

definition.en: to do what someone else does or to accept their guidance; to copy or imitate their actions
definition.zh: 跟着某人做；听从某人的带领；效仿某人的做法

examples.en: I wasn’t sure what to do, so I followed Maria’s lead.
examples.zh: 我不确定该怎么做，所以就跟着玛丽亚的做法。

examples.en: If you follow your teacher’s lead, you’ll learn the method faster.
examples.zh: 如果你跟着老师的引导，你会更快学会这个方法。

examples.en: Many companies followed Apple’s lead and removed the headphone jack.
examples.zh: 很多公司效仿苹果，取消了耳机孔。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow someone’s lead（跟着某人的做法/带领）；follow the lead of someone/something（效仿某人/某事）。
语气通常中性：可以表示“听从指导”，也可以表示“模仿趋势/做法”（尤其在商业、科技、社会现象中）。
相关名词用法：take the lead（带头、领先）；give someone a lead（给某人线索/方向，较少见于此短语语境）。
etymology: 源自“lead（带领、领先）”的本义：原指“跟随领路者的方向/路线”，后来引申为“照着某人的做法或指引去做”。
mnemonic: 把 lead 想成“领路的人/领头羊”，follow someone’s lead 就是“跟着领路者走”。
联想中文“跟着某人带头做”，其中“带头”≈ lead，“跟着”≈ follow。

summary.en: to check, continue, or investigate after an earlier action
summary.zh: 在先前行动后继续跟进、确认或追查

definition.en: To do something additional after an earlier action or communication, in order to get more information, confirm details, or make sure something is completed.
definition.zh: （在先前的行动或沟通之后）进一步跟进，以获取更多信息、确认细节或确保事情完成。

examples.en: I emailed the company yesterday, and I’ll follow it up with a phone call today.
examples.zh: 我昨天给公司发了邮件，今天会再打电话跟进。

examples.en: The nurse will follow up with you next week to discuss your test results.
examples.zh: 护士下周会联系你跟进并讨论检测结果。

examples.en: If you don’t hear back, follow it up in a couple of days.
examples.zh: 如果没收到回复，过两天再跟进一下。

definition.en: To investigate or pursue a lead, story, complaint, or idea to see what is true or what can be done.
definition.zh: 追查/落实线索、报道、投诉或想法，看看真相如何或能采取什么措施。

examples.en: The reporter followed up the tip and found important documents.
examples.zh: 记者跟进了这条线索，找到了重要文件。

examples.en: We’re following up on several customer complaints.
examples.zh: 我们正在跟进几起客户投诉。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow something up with something（用某种方式继续跟进）/ follow up on something（就某事继续追踪）。
口语和职场邮件里很常用：Just following up…（只是来跟进一下……），语气通常礼貌但带有“提醒/推进”的意思。
etymology: 来自动词 follow（跟随、继续）+ up（表示“进一步、向前推进”的方向/完成意义）。合起来常表示“在原有基础上再推进一步”，尤用于邮件、电话、医疗回访、调查等语境。
mnemonic: 把 up 理解为“往上再推一把”：follow（跟着做）+ up（再往前推进）＝“进一步跟进”。
联想“回访”：医生/客服常说 follow up，表示“之后再联系确认情况”。

summary.en: Copy someone’s actions after they do something first.
summary.zh: 在别人先做之后照样去做、效仿其做法。

definition.en: To do the same thing as someone else; to copy their example or behavior (often after they act first).
definition.zh: 效仿；跟着做；照着别人的做法来做（通常是在对方先做之后）。

examples.en: When one company lowered prices, its competitors quickly followed suit.
examples.zh: 一家公司的降价后，竞争对手很快也跟着降价。

examples.en: She started bringing lunch from home, and her coworkers followed suit.
examples.zh: 她开始自带午餐，同事们也纷纷效仿。

examples.en: If you turn off your phone, I’ll follow suit.
examples.zh: 如果你把手机关了，我也照做。

extraExplanation: 常用于正式或新闻写作，表示“某人做了X，其他人也做X”。
和 follow the suit（打牌术语“跟牌/跟花色”）不同：follow suit 是固定表达，意思是“效仿”。
etymology: 源自英语里的 suit（衣服、套装），原义与“跟同一套（穿着）”的做法相关，引申为“跟着做同样的事”。
mnemonic: 把 suit 想成“西装一套”：别人穿上这套，你也“跟着穿同一套”→ 跟着做。
联想中文“照着做/跟风”：follow（跟随）+ suit（同一套）= 跟同一套做法。

summary.en: Conform to what most people do or think rather than deciding independently.
summary.zh: 随大流；从众而非独立判断。

definition.en: To do what most people are doing or believe, instead of thinking or deciding independently.
definition.zh: 随大流；跟着大多数人做（不独立思考或决定）。

examples.en: Don’t just follow the crowd—choose what fits you best.
examples.zh: 别只是随大流——选择最适合你的。

examples.en: He followed the crowd and invested because everyone else was doing it.
examples.zh: 他随大流去投资，因为大家都在这么做。

examples.en: It’s easy to follow the crowd on social media, but harder to think for yourself.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上随大流很容易，但独立思考更难。

extraExplanation: 语气通常略带批评或提醒：强调“从众”可能让你失去独立判断。
近义但常更负面：go with the flow（随波逐流，更强调不费心/不抵抗）；jump on the bandwagon（跟风，强调看到某事流行才加入）。
etymology: 字面意思是“跟着人群走”。crowd 指“人群/大众”，后来引申为“跟大众的选择或观点走”，常用来谈从众心理与社会压力。
mnemonic: crowd = 人群；follow = 跟随 → “跟着人群走”＝“随大流”。
联想中文“从众”：从（跟从）+ 众（大众）。

summary.en: To keep up with what is popular and trendy, in style or behavior.
summary.zh: 追随流行潮流（穿着或行为上跟着热门趋势走）。

definition.en: To dress, buy, or behave in the way that is currently popular; to keep up with trends.
definition.zh: 追随当下流行；按潮流穿衣、购买或行为做事。

examples.en: She likes to follow the fashion, so she often buys new clothes each season.
examples.zh: 她喜欢追随潮流，所以每个季节都常买新衣服。

examples.en: You don’t have to follow the fashion to look professional at work.
examples.zh: 你不必追随流行，照样可以在工作中看起来很专业。

examples.en: Many teenagers follow the fashion they see on social media.
examples.zh: 很多青少年会追随他们在社交媒体上看到的潮流。

definition.en: More broadly, to follow what most people are doing or what society expects.
definition.zh: （更广义）随大流；按社会主流或他人期待行事。

examples.en: He followed the fashion and chose a “safe” career, even though he loved art.
examples.zh: 他随大流选了份“稳妥”的职业，尽管他热爱艺术。

examples.en: It’s easy to follow the fashion of opinion instead of thinking for yourself.
examples.zh: 人很容易跟着主流观点走，而不是独立思考。

extraExplanation: 用法提示：更常见的说法是 follow fashion 或 follow the latest fashion/trends；follow the fashion 带有一点“随波逐流/跟风”的语气时也很自然，语境决定褒贬。
近义表达：keep up with trends（跟上潮流）偏中性；jump on the bandwagon（跟风）更偏贬义。
etymology: 源自英语名词 fashion（时尚、流行、风尚），来自古法语 façon（做法、方式、样式）。短语 follow the fashion 直译是“跟随流行的样式/风尚”，逐渐固定为“追随潮流”。
mnemonic: 把 fashion 记成“法（fa）+ 形（xing）≈ 形式/样式”，follow the fashion 就是“跟着样式走”。
联想中文“跟风”：follow = 跟随，fashion = 风尚/潮流 → “跟随潮流”。

summary.en: act the same as the majority without independent thought
summary.zh: 不经独立思考地从众、跟风

definition.en: to do what most other people do or to accept the same opinions as the majority, often without thinking independently
definition.zh: 随大流；盲从大众（常指不加思考地跟着多数人做或想）

examples.en: Don’t just follow the herd—think about what you really want.
examples.zh: 别只会随大流——想想你真正想要什么。

examples.en: He invested in that stock because everyone else was doing it; he was just following the herd.
examples.zh: 他买那只股票是因为大家都在买；他只是在盲从。

examples.en: It’s easy to follow the herd on social media and repeat popular opinions.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上随大流、重复热门观点很容易。

extraExplanation: 语气常带一点批评或提醒：暗示缺乏独立思考。
相关概念：心理学中的“从众效应”；金融语境里指投资者因他人行动而跟风买卖。
etymology: 源自畜群（herd）行为的比喻：动物会成群移动，人也会在群体压力或从众心理下“跟着走”。在经济学里常见“herd behavior（羊群效应）”的用法。
mnemonic: 把 herd 想成“牛羊一大群”，你跟着它们走＝随大流。
联想中文“羊群效应”：看到“herd”就想到“跟风”。

summary.en: Please provide a word or phrase to look up.
summary.zh: 请提供要查询的单词或短语。

extraExplanation:
你可以直接回复：
1) 单词/短语：______
2) 你的水平（可选）：初级/中级
3) 想侧重：口语/写作/考试/阅读（可选）
etymology: 请告诉我你想查询的英文单词或短语（也可以发一句包含它的例句），我会按你要求的格式给出：音标（美式 IPA）、词性与双语释义、1–3 条双语例句、同义词、词源、记忆法等。

summary.en: act according to ethical standards
summary.zh: 按伦理与道德标准行事

definition.en: to behave according to accepted moral principles; to do what is considered right and ethical
definition.zh: 遵守道德准则；按公认的伦理标准行事

examples.en: Even when no one was watching, she tried to follow the morals her parents taught her.
examples.zh: 即使没人看着，她也努力遵守父母教给她的道德准则。

examples.en: The story encourages young people to follow the morals of honesty and kindness.
examples.zh: 这个故事鼓励年轻人遵循诚实与善良的道德准则。

examples.en: It’s easy to talk about values, but harder to follow the morals in daily life.
examples.zh: 谈论价值观很容易，但在日常生活中践行道德准则更难。

extraExplanation: 这个表达能被理解，但在现代英语里更常见、更自然的说法是：follow moral principles / live by a moral code / do the right thing。
注意 morals（复数）通常指“道德观念/准则”；moral（单数）常指“（故事的）寓意、道理”，如：The moral of the story is…（这个故事的寓意是……）。
etymology: “follow”源自古英语，意为“跟随、遵从”；“morals”来自拉丁语词根，和“品行、道德”相关。合在一起表示“遵循道德规范”。
mnemonic: follow=“跟着走/照着做”，morals=“道德”；合起来就是“照着道德去做”。
把 morals 联想成中文“莫（moral）做亏心事”：提醒自己按良心与道德行事。

summary.en: keep up with what is currently popular in style
summary.zh: 跟上当下流行的风格与潮流

definition.en: to start doing or wearing what is currently popular; to keep up with the latest styles or trends
definition.zh: 追随最新潮流；跟上当下流行的穿搭或做法

examples.en: Many teenagers try to follow the new fashion in clothes and hairstyles.
examples.zh: 很多青少年会在衣服和发型上追随最新潮流。

examples.en: You don’t have to follow the new fashion to look neat and confident.
examples.zh: 你不必追随最新潮流，也能看起来整洁又自信。

examples.en: Brands change designs quickly to help customers follow the new fashion.
examples.zh: 品牌快速更换设计，帮助顾客跟上新潮流。

synonyms: keep up with the latest trends
extraExplanation: “fashion”常指一段时间里被广泛接受的穿衣风格、审美或生活方式；更口语的“trend”范围更广（科技、社交媒体、饮食等也可用）。
语气中性：可以只是描述“跟潮流”，也可能带一点“盲目跟风”的暗示，具体取决于语境。若想表达更积极的“很时髦”，也可说“be fashionable”或“be in fashion”。
etymology: 这是由常见动词短语“follow (追随、跟随)”+ 名词短语“the new fashion（最新时尚/新潮流）”组成的搭配。“fashion”来自法语，原义与“制作方式/样式”有关，后来引申为“流行的风格”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow=跟随；new=新的；fashion≈“发型/穿搭的流行方式”。合起来就是“跟着新的时尚走”。
联想中文：看到“新款上新”，就会“跟风买”，= follow the new fashion。

summary.en: go after; obey; understand; happen afterward
summary.zh: 跟随；遵守；理解；随后发生

definition.en: Used to show that you will do what someone says or what a rule requires; to obey.
definition.zh: 用于表示按某人所说或按规定去做；遵从、服从。

examples.en: Please follow the instructions carefully.
examples.zh: 请仔细按照说明操作。

examples.en: He refused to follow the rules.
examples.zh: 他拒绝遵守规则。

examples.en: If you follow this advice, you’ll improve quickly.
examples.zh: 如果你照这个建议做，你会进步很快。

definition.en: To go after someone or something; to come behind.
definition.zh: 跟在后面走；追随、跟踪。

examples.en: The dog followed me home.
examples.zh: 那只狗跟着我回家了。

examples.en: She followed him into the room.
examples.zh: 她跟着他走进了房间。

definition.en: To happen or come after something in time; to be the result of something.
definition.zh: （时间上）随后发生；由……引起、随之而来。

examples.en: A period of silence followed the announcement.
examples.zh: 宣布之后是一阵沉默。

examples.en: Success often follows hard work.
examples.zh: 成功常常伴随努力而来。

definition.en: To understand something said or done; to keep up with an explanation or story.
definition.zh: 理解；听懂；跟得上（讲解/故事）。

examples.en: I’m sorry, I don’t quite follow.
examples.zh: 抱歉，我没太听懂。

examples.en: Can you speak more slowly so I can follow?
examples.zh: 你能说慢一点让我跟得上吗？

definition.en: The set of people who support a leader or public figure (often online).
definition.zh: （对某位人物的）拥护者群体；粉丝/关注者（常见于网络）。

examples.en: She has a large following on social media.
examples.zh: 她在社交媒体上有很多关注者。

examples.en: The singer’s following grew after the new album.
examples.zh: 这位歌手的新专辑后，粉丝群体扩大了。

extraExplanation: 常见固定用法：follow the rules（遵守规则）、follow instructions（按说明做）、follow someone（跟着某人）、follow a story/lecture（听懂/跟得上）、as follows（如下）。
口语里“I don’t follow.”常用于表达“我没听懂/没跟上你的意思”，语气比“ I don’t understand.”更委婉一些。
etymology: 源自古英语“folgian”，意为“跟随、追随”。后来引申出“遵守（规则）”“理解（话语）”“结果随之发生”等含义。
mnemonic: 把它拆成“fol- + low”：想象“跟着（follow）走在低处（low）的小路上”，就是“跟随”。
联想中文“跟”：follow = 跟随；follow the rules = 跟规则走 = 遵守。

summary.en: carry out a plan or promise fully; also the finishing motion in sports
summary.zh: 把计划或承诺落实到底；也指体育动作的随挥收尾

definition.en: to do what you promised or planned; to complete an action so it actually happens
definition.zh: 把承诺或计划落实到底；把事情做完并确保发生

examples.en: She said she would call the client, and she followed through the next morning.
examples.zh: 她说会给客户打电话，第二天早上就落实去做了。

examples.en: If you don’t follow through on your goals, they stay as ideas.
examples.zh: 如果你不把目标落实行动，它们就只是想法。

examples.en: He followed through with the training plan and improved quickly.
examples.zh: 他把训练计划坚持执行到位，进步很快。

definition.en: (sports) the finishing part of a swing, throw, or hit after contact, as the body continues the motion
definition.zh: （体育）击球/投掷后的“随挥动作”；动作完成后的延伸与收尾

examples.en: Keep your follow-through on the tennis serve to improve accuracy.
examples.zh: 发球时保持随挥动作，有助于提高准确性。

examples.en: In golf, a smooth follow-through often shows good control.
examples.zh: 在高尔夫里，顺畅的随挥动作通常说明控制力更好。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow through on + 名词（落实/履行……），如 follow through on a promise/plan/decision。
也常见：follow through with + 名词（把某事坚持做完），如 follow through with treatment/training。
注意：当作动词短语用时，通常不写连字符；作名词（体育/动作收尾）时常写作 follow-through。
etymology: 源自“follow（跟随）+ through（穿过/到底）”，比喻“跟着一件事一直走到结束”，引申为“把事情做到底、落实”。体育义来自动作“跟到最后”的收尾阶段。
mnemonic: 把 through 理解成“到头/到底”：follow（跟着）+ through（到底）= 跟着做到底→落实。
联想中文“说到做到”：说了就要 follow through。

summary.en: to complete an intended action or keep a commitment
summary.zh: 把承诺或计划执行到底、兑现

definition.en: to do what you said you would do; to keep a promise or commitment by taking the necessary actions until it is finished
definition.zh: 兑现承诺；把答应的事落实到底（说到做到并完成）

examples.en: If you say you’ll apply for the job, you need to follow through on it.
examples.zh: 如果你说要申请那份工作，你就得把这件事落实到底。

examples.en: The team didn’t follow through on their plan, so the project stalled.
examples.zh: 团队没有把计划执行到底，所以项目停滞了。

examples.en: She always follows through on her promises.
examples.zh: 她总是信守承诺、说到做到。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow through on a promise/plan/decision/commitment/goal/threat（兑现承诺/贯彻计划/落实决定/履行承诺/实现目标/把威胁付诸行动）。
语气与用法：常用于强调“不是只说或只开始，而是坚持到完成”。比 carry out 更口语、也更强调“坚持到底”。
etymology: 来自短语动词 follow through（“跟进到最后、做完”）：follow（跟随、继续）+ through（从头到尾、彻底）。加上 on 表示“针对某件事/某个承诺”。常用于商业、学习与日常承诺语境。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow（跟着）+ through（穿过去=到最后）+ on（在某事上）→“在这件事上一路做到最后”。
联想中文：对一件事“跟到底、做到底”= 说到做到。

summary.en: to keep your word and complete what you promised or started
summary.zh: 说到做到，把承诺或计划落实并完成

definition.en: to do what you said you would do; to complete a plan, promise, or responsibility instead of stopping halfway
definition.zh: 履行承诺；把计划/责任落实到底（而不是半途而废）

examples.en: If you make a promise, you should follow through on it.
examples.zh: 如果你做出承诺，就应该把它兑现。

examples.en: The team followed through on its commitment to reduce waste by 20%.
examples.zh: 团队落实了将浪费减少20%的承诺。

examples.en: She apologized and followed through by changing her behavior.
examples.zh: 她道歉了，并且通过改变行为把话落到了实处。

definition.en: (sports) to continue a movement after hitting or throwing, as part of good technique
definition.zh: （体育）做完整随挥动作；出手后动作继续完成（技术要领）

examples.en: Keep your eyes on the ball and follow through after you swing.
examples.zh: 盯住球，挥拍后要把随挥动作做完整。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow through on + 名词（a promise / a plan / a commitment / an agreement / a threat）。其中 on 表示“在……之上继续推进”，强调把事情落实到完成。
语气区别：carry out 更像“执行（命令/任务）”；fulfill 更正式，常用于“履行（义务/承诺）”；follow through 强调“别停在口头或中途，要坚持到最后”。
etymology: 源自动词短语“follow through”，字面意思是“跟着做完/贯穿到底”。早期用于一般行动的“进行到底”，后在体育语境中也指击球或投掷后的“随挥/随动作”。
mnemonic: 把它想成“follow（跟上）+ through（穿过去/贯穿）”：一直跟到最后，事情就“做到底”。
联想中文“说到做到”：说了就要跟进并做完＝follow through (on).

summary.en: carry out and complete what was planned or promised
summary.zh: 把计划或承诺落实并完成

definition.en: to do what you said you would do; to complete an action or plan (especially after making a promise or decision)
definition.zh: 贯彻到底；说到做到；把（计划/承诺）落实完成

examples.en: If you promise to help, you need to follow through with it.
examples.zh: 如果你答应帮忙，就需要把这件事落实到底。

examples.en: She followed through with her training and ran her first marathon.
examples.zh: 她坚持完成训练，跑完了人生第一个马拉松。

examples.en: The team didn’t follow through with the changes they announced.
examples.zh: 团队没有把他们宣布的改动真正落实。

definition.en: to continue doing something until it is fully finished, even when it becomes difficult
definition.zh: 坚持做完；不半途而废

examples.en: It’s hard, but if you follow through with the project, you’ll learn a lot.
examples.zh: 这很难，但如果你把项目坚持做完，会学到很多。

examples.en: He tends to start strong but doesn’t always follow through with tasks.
examples.zh: 他往往开头很有劲，但不总能把任务坚持完成。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow through with a plan/promise/decision/idea/commitment（把计划/承诺/决定/想法/责任落实）。
语法提示：with 后面通常接名词或动名词（V-ing）。如：follow through with fixing the bug（把修复漏洞这事做到底）。
etymology: 源自短语动词 follow through（把动作“跟到底/做到最后”），原意与动作的“完成整个过程”有关；with 表示“对某事采取后续行动并完成”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow（跟上）+ through（穿过去/到最后）+ with（带着某事）→“带着这件事一路做到最后”。
联想中文“跟到底、做到位”：跟（follow）到底（through）这件事（with）。

summary.en: carry out a plan or promise to completion
summary.zh: 把计划或承诺贯彻到底、执行完成

definition.en: to do what you promised or planned; to finish something you started
definition.zh: 把承诺或计划落实到底；把开始的事做完

examples.en: If you say you’ll apply for the scholarship, make sure you follow through with it.
examples.zh: 如果你说要申请奖学金，就一定要把这件事落实到底。

examples.en: She followed through with her workout plan even when she was busy.
examples.zh: 即使很忙，她也坚持把健身计划执行到底。

examples.en: The team didn’t follow through with the changes they announced.
examples.zh: 团队没有把他们宣布的改动真正落实。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow through with + 名词/代词（follow through with the plan / with it）。
也可以用不及物结构：follow through（不加with），强调“坚持做完”：He never follows through.
和“follow up”不同：follow up偏“后续跟进/询问进展”，follow through偏“真正做完/落实承诺”。
etymology: 源自短语动词“follow through”，原意有“跟进到底、完成动作（尤其在体育动作中继续完成后续动作）”，后来引申为“把计划/承诺贯彻到底”。
mnemonic: 把它想成“follow（跟着）through（穿过去）”：一路跟到底→事情做到底、做完。
联想中文“贯彻到底/说到做到”，就对应follow through with。

summary.en: obey road safety laws and instructions
summary.zh: 遵守道路交通安全法规与指示

definition.en: to obey the laws and instructions that control how vehicles and pedestrians should move on roads
definition.zh: 遵守交通规则；按交通法规行驶/通行

examples.en: Always follow traffic rules, especially near schools.
examples.zh: 一定要遵守交通规则，尤其是在学校附近。

examples.en: If you follow traffic rules, you reduce the risk of accidents.
examples.zh: 如果你遵守交通规则，就能降低事故风险。

examples.en: Tourists should follow traffic rules when crossing the street.
examples.zh: 游客过马路时也应该遵守交通规则。

synonyms: follow the rules of the road
extraExplanation: 常见近义表达：obey traffic laws / observe traffic regulations / comply with traffic rules。
搭配提醒：更自然的说法还包括 follow the rules of the road（遵守道路规则）。在美式英语中 traffic laws（交通法规）也很常见。
etymology: 这是一个现代英语常用搭配：follow（跟随→遵从）+ traffic rules（交通规则）。follow 在这里不是“跟在后面”，而是“遵守/照做”。
mnemonic: 把 follow 记成“照着做”：看到规则就“跟着做”，就是“遵守”。
traffic（车流）+ rules（规则）→ 在车流中要按规则走。

summary.en: keep up with what’s popular or track how things change over time
summary.zh: 跟随流行；或追踪事物随时间变化的趋势

definition.en: to do what is popular or fashionable at a particular time; to keep up with changes in style, opinions, or behavior
definition.zh: 跟随潮流；追随当下流行的风格、观点或行为

examples.en: Some brands follow trends too quickly and lose their own style.
examples.zh: 有些品牌追潮流太快，反而失去了自己的风格。

examples.en: You don’t have to follow trends to dress well.
examples.zh: 你不一定要跟随潮流才能穿得好看。

definition.en: to track and observe changes or patterns over time (in data, markets, or public interest)
definition.zh: 追踪趋势；观察数据、市场或关注度随时间变化的规律

examples.en: Analysts follow trends in housing prices to predict the market.
examples.zh: 分析师会追踪房价趋势来预测市场。

examples.en: We follow trends in customer feedback to improve the product.
examples.zh: 我们会跟踪客户反馈的趋势来改进产品。

extraExplanation: 常见语境：时尚/社交媒体里多指“追流行”；商业/数据分析里更像“跟踪趋势、看走势”。
语气上可能略带评价：说别人“follow trends”有时暗示“缺少主见/随大流”，但也可能是中性描述（如市场分析）。
etymology: “trend”原指“转向、倾向、走向”（像河流或海岸线的走向），后来引申为“事物发展的趋势/潮流”。“follow trends”就是“跟着趋势走”。
mnemonic: follow=跟随；trends=趋势/潮流 → 直译“跟着潮流走”。
把trend想成“趋势线”（图表上的线），follow trends=“跟着线走/看线怎么变”。

summary.en: continue by taking another step or contacting again; a later checking action
summary.zh: 继续推进或再次联系确认；后续跟进事项

definition.en: to take further action or make contact again to check progress, get more information, or continue something
definition.zh: 跟进；追问；（为确认进展/获取更多信息而）再联系、继续处理

examples.en: I’ll follow up with you next week about the schedule.
examples.zh: 我下周会就日程再跟你确认一下。

examples.en: The doctor asked me to follow up if the pain gets worse.
examples.zh: 医生让我如果疼痛加重就再来复诊/联系。

examples.en: We emailed the company and followed up by phone the next day.
examples.zh: 我们先给公司发了邮件，第二天又打电话跟进。

definition.en: an additional action, message, or appointment that happens after the first one to continue or confirm something
definition.zh: 后续行动；跟进（电话/邮件/会议/复诊等）

examples.en: Can we schedule a follow-up meeting?
examples.zh: 我们能安排一次后续会议吗？

examples.en: Thanks for the follow-up on my application.
examples.zh: 谢谢你对我申请的后续跟进。

definition.en: done after an earlier event to continue or check on it
definition.zh: 后续的；跟进的

examples.en: She sent a follow-up email with the details.
examples.zh: 她又发了一封后续邮件补充细节。

examples.en: A follow-up call confirmed the order.
examples.zh: 一个跟进电话确认了订单。

extraExplanation: 拼写提示：作动词短语通常写 follow up（不加连字符），如 follow up on an issue；作名词或形容词更常写 follow-up，如 a follow-up email / a follow-up appointment。
常见搭配：follow up with someone（跟某人再联系）；follow up on something（就某事跟进/追问）；follow-up appointment（复诊）；follow-up question（追问）。
etymology: 由“follow（跟随）+ up（向上/继续）”构成的短语动词，含义引申为“在前一步之后继续推进”。名词/形容词形式常写作 follow-up（带连字符）。
mnemonic: 把它想成“跟着（follow）往上继续（up）”：前面做了一步，后面再继续推进=跟进。
联想中文工作语境里的“FU”：很多公司把 follow up 简写成 FU（注意正式场合尽量写全）。

summary.en: take further action or check again about something
summary.zh: 对某事进一步处理或再次核实

definition.en: to take further action about something (for example, to check, investigate, or continue dealing with it)
definition.zh: 对某事采取进一步行动（例如核实、调查、继续处理）

examples.en: I’ll follow up on your request and get back to you tomorrow.
examples.zh: 我会跟进你的请求，明天再回复你。

examples.en: The police followed up on several leads.
examples.zh: 警方对几条线索进行了进一步调查。

definition.en: to contact someone again to get an update or confirm details
definition.zh: 再次联系某人以了解进展或确认细节

examples.en: She followed up on the interview with a thank-you email.
examples.zh: 她在面试后发了一封致谢邮件作跟进。

examples.en: Can you follow up on the invoice with the supplier?
examples.zh: 你能就这张发票再跟供应商确认一下吗？

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：follow up on a request/complaint/lead/issue（跟进请求/投诉/线索/问题）。
易混点：follow up（不带 on）更像“后续跟进（动作本身）”；follow up on + 事项，强调“针对某件事继续处理”。
etymology: 由“follow（跟随）+ up（向前/继续）+ on（关于/针对）”组合而成；原意是“接着做、继续追踪”，逐渐固定为商务与日常中常用的“跟进某事”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow（跟着）+ up（继续往下做）+ on（针对某事）= “针对某事继续追”。
联想中文职场高频词“跟进”：看到 on 就想“跟进 on 这件事”。

summary.en: Request for clarification about what item to continue with.
summary.zh: 请求澄清要继续讲解的具体内容。

definition.en: I’m not sure what you want me to follow up with. Please tell me the word/phrase you want explained, or paste the sentence you saw it in.
definition.zh: 我不确定你想让我“follow up with”什么内容。请告诉我你想查询的单词/短语，或把它出现的句子发来。

examples.en: Which word should I follow up with next?
examples.zh: 接下来你希望我继续讲哪个词？

examples.en: Please paste the full sentence so I can explain it in context.
examples.zh: 请把完整句子贴出来，我可以结合语境解释。

summary.en: an investor who joins a later funding round after earlier investors
summary.zh: 在前一轮融资之后参与后续轮次的投资者（跟投方）

definition.en: An investor who invests after an earlier investor or after an initial funding round (for example, after a seed round), usually in a later round such as Series A/B.
definition.zh: 跟投投资者；指在已有投资者或已有融资轮（如种子轮）之后再进入、参与后续融资（如A/B轮）的人或机构。

examples.en: The startup raised $2 million from a lead investor and several follow-on investors.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司在领投方之外，还从多家跟投投资者那里筹集了200万美元。

examples.en: As a follow-on investor, the fund focused on scaling companies that already had product-market fit.
examples.zh: 作为跟投方，该基金主要投资那些已经验证产品市场匹配、准备扩张的公司。

examples.en: The company wanted follow-on investors to strengthen its cap table before the next round.
examples.zh: 公司希望引入跟投投资者，以在下一轮融资前增强股东结构（cap table）。

extraExplanation: 在创投语境里，常见搭配有：lead investor（领投方）与 follow-on investors（跟投方）。领投方通常谈估值、定条款并起“带头”作用；跟投方多在条款确定后按相同或相近条款出资。
注意区分：follow-on investor（后续轮进入的投资者）与 follow-on investment（同一投资者对已投项目的追加投资）。两者相关但不完全相同。
etymology: 来自投资语境中“follow-on（后续的、跟进的）+ investor（投资者）”。“follow-on”本义为“后续/接续”，在风险投资与私募融资中引申为“后续轮次的追加或跟进投资”。
mnemonic: 把 follow-on 理解成“跟上去/跟着来”：前面有人投了，你“跟上”参与后续轮，就是跟投。
联想中文“跟投”，follow（跟）+ on（上/继续）→ 跟上继续投。

summary.en: “Follow-ons” means later actions, events, or effects that come after something else; in investing, it can mean additional funding after an initial investment.
summary.zh: “follow-ons”指某事之后的后续行动/事件/影响；在投资语境中也可指首轮投资后的追加融资/追加投资。

definition.en: Things that happen or are done after something else as a result or continuation; follow-up events, actions, or effects.
definition.zh: 后续事项；随之而来的行动/事件/影响；延伸出来的结果。

examples.en: The meeting went well, but we still have several follow-ons to complete next week.
examples.zh: 会议进展顺利，但下周我们还有好几个后续事项要完成。

examples.en: A change in schedule can create follow-ons for the whole team.
examples.zh: 日程的变动可能会给整个团队带来一连串后续影响。

examples.en: The policy had unexpected follow-ons, including higher costs.
examples.zh: 这项政策带来了意想不到的连锁后果，包括成本上升。

definition.en: In business and investing: additional rounds or add-on investments made after an initial investment (often called “follow-on funding”).
definition.zh: （商业/投资）追加投资；在首次投资之后进行的后续融资（常称“follow-on funding”）。

examples.en: The startup raised a seed round and later secured follow-ons from the same investors.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司完成了种子轮，之后又从同一批投资人那里拿到了追加投资。

examples.en: We’re reserving capital for follow-ons in our strongest portfolio companies.
examples.zh: 我们预留资金，用于对表现最强的被投公司进行后续追加投资。

extraExplanation: “follow-on / follow-ons”常见于职场和项目管理语境，强调“主事件之后必须处理的延伸任务/影响”。在风险投资语境里，它常指“后续融资/追加投资”，与“seed/Series A”等轮次概念一起出现。
拼写上也常见写法：follow-on（单数/形容词用法）、follow-ons（复数名词）。有时也会写作 follow on（较口语或较少见的分写形式）。

summary.en: “Follow-the-leader” is a children’s copying game, and it can also describe mindless imitation in groups.
summary.zh: “follow-the-leader”既指儿童模仿领头人的游戏，也可比喻群体中的盲从/跟风行为。

definition.en: A children’s game where one person (the leader) does an action or movement and everyone else copies it.
definition.zh: （儿童游戏）“跟着领头人做”，一个人当领头做动作/行为，其他人模仿。

examples.en: At recess we played follow-the-leader around the playground.
examples.zh: 课间休息时，我们在操场上玩“跟着领头人做”。

examples.en: She became the leader, and we all did silly walks in follow-the-leader.
examples.zh: 她当了领头人，我们在“跟着领头人做”里一起学着搞笑走路。

definition.en: Describing a situation where people copy what someone else does instead of thinking or deciding for themselves.
definition.zh: （比喻）形容盲从、照着别人做，而不是自己思考或做决定。

examples.en: The meeting felt like follow-the-leader—everyone just agreed with the boss.
examples.zh: 那次会议感觉像“跟着领头人做”——大家只是附和老板。

examples.en: Don’t do follow-the-leader buying; research before you invest.
examples.zh: 别盲目跟风买入；投资前先做调查。

extraExplanation: 这个说法最常见的语境是儿童游戏：领头人做动作（走路方式、拍手、跳跃、转弯等），其他人按顺序模仿。后来常被用作比喻，指“跟风/盲从”的群体行为。书写上常见连字符形式 follow-the-leader，也有人写作 follow the leader。

summary.en: Follow-through means completing what you start (and, in sports, the motion after a hit or throw).
summary.zh: Follow-through 指把事情做到底、落实执行；在体育中也指击球/投掷后的随挥动作。

definition.en: the act of finishing what you start; continuing effort until a plan or task is completed
definition.zh: （把事情）做到底；贯彻到底；后续执行

examples.en: Good ideas are common, but follow-through is rare.
examples.zh: 好点子很常见，但能贯彻到底的人很少。

examples.en: She promised to help, and her follow-through was excellent.
examples.zh: 她答应帮忙，而且后续执行做得非常到位。

definition.en: in sports, the continued motion after you hit, throw, or swing, which helps control power and accuracy
definition.zh: （体育运动中）随挥动作；跟进动作（击球/投掷/挥拍后的继续动作，有助于力量与准确性）

examples.en: Keep your eyes on the ball and finish your follow-through.
examples.zh: 盯住球，并把随挥动作完成。

examples.en: A smooth follow-through can improve your tennis serve.
examples.zh: 流畅的随挥动作能提升你的网球发球。

extraExplanation: “follow-through”常用于职场与日常表达，强调“承诺之后的行动与落实”。比如：follow-through on a promise（兑现承诺）、lack of follow-through（缺乏执行力）。
在高尔夫、棒球、网球等运动里，它指动作完成后的“顺势延伸”，体现技术是否到位。

summary.en: A follow-up is a later action or event that continues or checks on something that happened earlier; it can also describe something done afterward (like a follow-up call or appointment).
summary.zh: follow-up 指在前一件事之后进行的后续行动/安排（如跟进电话、后续会议、复诊），也可作形容词表示“后续的”。

definition.en: Something done after an earlier action (such as a meeting, call, test, or interview) to check progress, get results, or continue the process.
definition.zh: 在先前行动（如会议、电话、检查或面试）之后进行的后续行动，用于了解进展、获取结果或继续推进。

examples.en: The doctor scheduled a follow-up to discuss my test results.
examples.zh: 医生安排了一次复诊（后续预约）来讨论我的检查结果。

examples.en: Please send a follow-up email after the meeting.
examples.zh: 会议后请发一封跟进邮件。

examples.en: We need a follow-up to make sure the plan is working.
examples.zh: 我们需要后续跟进，确保计划有效。

definition.en: Done after an earlier event to continue, confirm, or improve something.
definition.zh: 在之前事件之后进行的，用于继续推进、确认情况或改进的。

examples.en: I have a follow-up appointment next week.
examples.zh: 我下周有一次复诊（后续预约）。

examples.en: The team held a follow-up meeting to finalize the details.
examples.zh: 团队召开了后续会议来敲定细节。

extraExplanation: “follow-up”作名词时常见搭配：a follow-up call/email/visit/appointment/meeting。
书写上有三种常见形式：follow-up（名词/形容词最常见）、follow up（动词短语，如 “I will follow up with you.”）、followup（较少见，多见于某些英式或旧式写法）。
在商务语境里，“follow-up”通常强调“推进下一步/促成结果”；在医疗语境里常译为“复诊/复查”。

summary.en: A later task meant to continue or reinforce what came before.
summary.zh: 用于继续推进或巩固前序内容的后续任务/活动。

definition.en: An activity done after an earlier event, lesson, meeting, or task to check results, reinforce learning, or continue the work.
definition.zh: 在前一次活动、课程、会议或任务之后进行的后续活动，用于跟进结果、巩固学习或继续推进工作。

examples.en: After the workshop, the teacher assigned a follow-up activity to help students practice the new vocabulary.
examples.zh: 研讨课结束后，老师布置了一个后续活动，帮助学生练习新学的词汇。

examples.en: We’ll run a short follow-up activity next week to see whether the new process is working.
examples.zh: 下周我们会做一个简短的跟进活动，看看新流程是否有效。

extraExplanation: 拼写小贴士：作定语时常写作“follow-up activity”（带连字符）；不作定语或更口语时也常见“follow up activity”。在正式写作里带连字符更常见。
常见场景：课堂里用于“巩固/复习/检验理解”；工作中用于“复盘/落实行动项/检查进度”。
etymology: 由“follow up（跟进、追踪）”+“activity（活动）”组成；follow-up 原意是“跟随其后、继续追踪”，在商务与教育语境中常用来指“后续安排/动作”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow up=“跟上去继续追”，activity=“活动”，合起来就是“追踪后续要做的活动”。
联想“课后作业/课后练习”=一种典型的 follow-up activity。

summary.en: a later audit to verify that earlier issues were corrected
summary.zh: 对先前审计问题整改情况进行核实的后续审计

definition.en: an additional audit done after an initial audit to check whether problems were fixed and whether controls now work as intended
definition.zh: 初次审计之后进行的追加审计，用于核实问题是否已整改、控制措施是否按预期运行

examples.en: The regulator required follow-up auditing within six months to confirm the corrective actions were effective.
examples.zh: 监管机构要求在六个月内进行后续审计，以确认纠正措施有效。

examples.en: Follow-up auditing found that several high-risk issues were still unresolved.
examples.zh: 后续审计发现若干高风险问题仍未解决。

examples.en: Our internal audit team schedules follow-up auditing for all major findings.
examples.zh: 我们的内部审计团队会为所有重大发现安排后续审计。

definition.en: the process of tracking audit findings over time, including verifying evidence, deadlines, and management responses
definition.zh: 对审计发现进行持续跟踪的流程，包括核验证据、整改期限以及管理层回应

examples.en: Strong follow-up auditing helps ensure recommendations are actually implemented.
examples.zh: 有力的跟踪审计能确保建议真正落地执行。

examples.en: They used a dashboard to manage follow-up auditing across multiple departments.
examples.zh: 他们用仪表盘来管理跨多个部门的跟踪审计。

extraExplanation: 在企业合规与内审语境里，follow-up auditing 常与 audit findings（审计发现）、corrective actions（纠正措施）、remediation plan（整改计划）一起出现。
不要与 continuous auditing（持续审计，通常更自动化、更实时）混淆；follow-up auditing 通常是针对“已发现的问题”做复核。
etymology: 由“follow-up（后续跟进）+ auditing（审计）”组合而成：follow-up 强调“在之后再检查”，auditing 来自拉丁语 audire（听、听取报告），在现代语境中引申为“审查、核查”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow-up=“跟上去再看一眼”，auditing=“审计/核查”；合起来就是“审计后再跟进核查”。
联想中文工作流：发现问题→出整改→到期复查，这一步就是 follow-up auditing（到期复查审计）。

summary.en: a later check to confirm fixes or continued compliance after an earlier inspection
summary.zh: 在先前检查之后进行的复查，用于确认整改或持续合规

definition.en: a later inspection done to check progress, confirm that problems were fixed, or ensure requirements are still being met after an earlier inspection
definition.zh: 复查；后续检查（在先前检查之后进行，用于确认整改进展、问题是否已解决或是否持续符合要求）

examples.en: The health department scheduled a follow-up inspection for next week to confirm the violations were corrected.
examples.zh: 卫生部门安排了下周的后续检查，以确认违规问题已整改。

examples.en: After repairs, the building passed the follow-up inspection and reopened to the public.
examples.zh: 维修后，大楼通过了复查并重新对公众开放。

examples.en: Please keep all receipts and photos in case they ask for them during the follow-up inspection.
examples.zh: 请保留所有收据和照片，以防后续检查时需要提供。

extraExplanation: 常见场景：餐饮/卫生检查、消防检查、建筑验收、质量审计、合规监管等。
与 reinspection/second inspection 相近，但 follow-up inspection 更强调“针对上次发现的问题或整改计划进行跟进确认”，不一定只是“第二次”。
etymology: “follow-up”原意是“跟进、后续行动”（由动词短语 follow up 演变而来）；“inspection”来自拉丁语词根，意为“查看、审视”。组合起来就表示“跟进式的检查/复查”。
mnemonic: 把它拆开记：follow-up = 跟进；inspection = 检查 → “跟进检查/复查”。
联想工作场景：上次被指出问题→整改→再来一次确认，这就是 follow-up inspection。

summary.en: additional reporting that continues an earlier story
summary.zh: 对先前事件的进一步跟进报道

definition.en: news reports or articles that provide additional information after an earlier story has already been reported
definition.zh: （新闻）后续报道；对先前新闻的进一步跟进报道

examples.en: The newspaper published follow-up stories about the investigation a week later.
examples.zh: 这家报纸在一周后刊登了关于该调查的后续报道。

examples.en: Viewers wanted follow-up stories to learn what happened to the families after the storm.
examples.zh: 观众想看后续报道，了解风暴过后那些家庭的情况。

examples.en: The reporter promised follow-up stories if new evidence appeared.
examples.zh: 记者承诺如果出现新证据，就会推出后续报道。

definition.en: additional stories that continue or expand an earlier story in a broader sense (for example, in blogs, documentaries, or social media)
definition.zh: （更广义）续篇/延伸内容；对原故事的继续讲述或扩展（如博客、纪录片、社媒内容）

examples.en: The podcast released follow-up stories to answer listeners’ questions.
examples.zh: 这档播客发布了后续故事来回答听众的问题。

examples.en: She wrote follow-up stories about the characters’ lives after the original novel ended.
examples.zh: 她写了后续故事，讲述原小说结尾之后人物的生活。

extraExplanation: 写作与媒体常见搭配：follow-up story（单数）、follow-up stories（复数）；也常说“run/publish a follow-up story（刊登后续报道）”“do a follow-up（做跟进）”。
与“sequel”区别：sequel多指小说/电影的“续集”；follow-up stories更强调“在已有报道/内容基础上继续追踪进展”，尤其常见于新闻。
etymology: “follow-up”原意是“跟进、后续行动”，来自动词短语“follow up（继续跟进）”。在新闻语境中，“follow-up”逐渐固定用作形容词/名词，表示“对前一事件的延伸报道”；与“stories（报道/故事）”组合后，形成常见搭配。
mnemonic: 把follow-up想成“follow（跟着）+ up（继续往下/往后）”：事件还在发展，就“跟着继续”。
联想中文“跟进报道/后续”：看到follow-up就想到“后续跟进”。

summary.en: “Follow-ups” means later questions or actions after something earlier, especially to get more information or continue progress.
summary.zh: “follow-ups”指在先前事情之后进行的后续问题或跟进行动，用来补充信息或推进进展。

definition.en: Additional questions, actions, or contacts that happen after an earlier event or conversation to get more information or continue progress.
definition.zh: 在先前事件或对话之后，为获取更多信息或推进事情而进行的追加问题、行动或联系。

examples.en: After the interview, the recruiter sent a few follow-ups by email.
examples.zh: 面试后，招聘人员通过邮件发了几条后续跟进。

examples.en: I have two follow-ups: When will the report be ready, and who will review it?
examples.zh: 我有两个后续问题：报告什么时候完成？谁来审核？

examples.en: The doctor scheduled follow-ups to check how the treatment was working.
examples.zh: 医生安排了复诊随访来检查治疗效果。

definition.en: Plural form of “follow-up” meaning follow-up contacts or steps in business, research, healthcare, or customer service.
definition.zh: “follow-up”的复数形式，指多次后续联系或后续步骤（常用于商务、研究、医疗、客服等场景）。

examples.en: We did follow-ups with customers to see if they were satisfied.
examples.zh: 我们对客户做了后续回访，看看他们是否满意。

examples.en: The study included follow-ups at three and six months.
examples.zh: 该研究包含在三个月和六个月时的随访。

extraExplanation: “follow-up”既可以作名词（a follow-up / follow-ups），也常作形容词（a follow-up call 后续电话；follow-up questions 追问）。动词表达更常用“follow up (on/with)”，例如：I’ll follow up with you tomorrow.（我明天再跟你确认/联系。）
书写上：作名词或形容词时常见连字符“follow-up”；作动词短语时通常分开写“follow up”。不同机构风格指南可能略有差异，但这是最常见、最安全的用法。
语气与场景：在商务邮件里“follow-up(s)”很中性，表示礼貌推进；在医疗语境中常译为“复诊/随访”；在会议里常指“后续事项/行动项”。

summary.en: “Followable” means easy to follow—clear instructions or logic that people can understand and do.
summary.zh: “followable”表示“容易照着做/容易理解的”，常用于说明、步骤或逻辑清晰、让人跟得上。

definition.en: Easy to understand and use; clear enough that someone can follow the steps, rules, or logic.
definition.zh: 容易理解并照着做的；清晰到让人能跟得上步骤、规则或逻辑。

examples.en: The instructions are followable even for beginners.
examples.zh: 这些说明即使对初学者来说也很容易照着做。

examples.en: Try to write your code in a followable way, with clear comments.
examples.zh: 尽量把代码写得容易读懂、能跟得上思路，并加上清楚的注释。

examples.en: Her argument was simple and followable.
examples.zh: 她的论点很简单，也很容易理解。

extraExplanation: “followable”在英语里可用，但不如“easy to follow”“clear”“straightforward”“user-friendly（更偏用户体验）”常见。写作更正式时通常改用这些更自然的表达。
词形来源：follow + -able（表示“能够被……的”）。因此“followable”直观上就是“能被跟随/照做的”。
语感小提醒：如果强调“说明/步骤”是否好执行，用“easy to follow / clear instructions”更地道；如果强调“逻辑/叙述”是否好理解，可用“clear / coherent / easy to understand”。

summary.en: “Followed” usually means “went after” or “came next,” and it can also appear in the set phrase “the following…” meaning “the next / listed below.”
summary.zh: “followed”通常表示“跟随”或“随后发生”；在固定搭配“the following…”中表示“接下来的/如下的”。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “follow” (to go after someone/something, or to come next in order).
definition.zh: “follow”的过去式和过去分词（跟随；接着发生/出现）。

examples.en: She followed her friend into the library.
examples.zh: 她跟着朋友走进了图书馆。

examples.en: A long silence followed his question.
examples.zh: 他问完之后，紧接着是一阵长久的沉默。

definition.en: used like an adjective to describe someone/something that comes after (often in formal writing: “the following day/word”).
definition.zh: 作类似形容词的用法，表示“随后/下一个的”（常见于较正式表达：the following day/word）。

examples.en: We met again the following week.
examples.zh: 我们在接下来的一周又见面了。

examples.en: Please read the following instructions carefully.
examples.zh: 请仔细阅读以下说明。

extraExplanation: “followed”最常见是动词的过去式/过去分词：follow → followed。它既可以表示动作上的“跟着走”，也常用来表示事件顺序上的“随后发生”（A followed B）。
当你看到“the following + 名词”（如 the following day / the following reasons），它不是动词时态，而是一种固定搭配，意思接近“接下来的/如下的”。在学习中要把它和“followed”区分开。

summary.en: happening next or coming after; often used in “be followed by” to show sequence
summary.zh: 表示“随后发生/紧接着出现”，常用于“be followed by”说明先后顺序

definition.en: coming after something or someone; next in order or time
definition.zh: 在……之后的；随后的；接着发生的

examples.en: The meeting was followed by a short break.
examples.zh: 会议之后是一个短暂的休息。

examples.en: In the days followed by heavy rain, the river rose quickly.
examples.zh: 在接下来连日大雨中，河水迅速上涨。

definition.en: past participle of “follow”; used in passive voice to say someone/something came after or went behind
definition.zh: “follow”的过去分词；用于被动结构，表示“被跟随/被接着发生”

examples.en: The guide was followed by a group of tourists.
examples.zh: 导游后面跟着一群游客。

examples.en: Her speech was followed by loud applause.
examples.zh: 她的演讲之后响起了热烈的掌声。

examples.en: The suspect was followed for two hours.
examples.zh: 嫌疑人被跟踪了两个小时。

extraExplanation: 常见结构：be followed by + 名词/动名词，表示“之后紧接着发生/出现……”。例如：The announcement was followed by cheers（宣布之后是欢呼）。
学习提示：followed by 通常强调“先后顺序”（A 之后紧接 B），不强调因果；若要表达“导致”，更常用 lead to / result in。
etymology: 源自古英语 followian（“跟随、追随”），与“在后面走/追随”的核心含义相关；过去分词 followed 表示“已经跟随/已被跟随”。
mnemonic: 把 follow 理解成“跟着走”，followed by 就是“后面跟着……/后面接着是……”。
联想：电影字幕里常见“followed by…”表示“随后出现……”，就像画面一转接下一幕。

summary.en: A follower is someone who follows or supports a person or idea; today it commonly means a social-media subscriber.
summary.zh: follower 指追随或支持某人/某种理念的人；在当代也常指社交媒体的关注者/粉丝。

definition.en: A person who supports, admires, or regularly pays attention to someone (often a leader, celebrity, or creator).
definition.zh: 追随者；拥护者；粉丝（经常关注或支持某人，如领导者、名人或内容创作者的人）。

examples.en: She has thousands of followers on Instagram.
examples.zh: 她在 Instagram 上有成千上万的粉丝。

examples.en: The teacher’s followers appreciated her clear, patient style.
examples.zh: 那位老师的拥护者很欣赏她清晰而有耐心的风格。

definition.en: A person who comes after or walks behind another person; someone who follows.
definition.zh: 跟随在后的人；后面的人（跟在他人后面走或后来到的人）。

examples.en: The guide walked ahead, and the followers stayed close behind.
examples.zh: 向导走在前面，跟随的人紧紧跟在后面。

definition.en: In social media, an account that subscribes to or tracks another account’s updates.
definition.zh: （社交媒体）关注者（订阅或接收另一个账号更新的人或账号）。

examples.en: He gained new followers after posting the video.
examples.zh: 他发布那段视频后新增了很多关注者。

examples.en: Brands often measure success by likes and followers.
examples.zh: 品牌常用点赞数和关注者数量来衡量成效。

extraExplanation: “follower”来自动词“follow”（跟随）。在传统语境里常指“追随者/信徒/拥护者”；在当代网络语境中非常常见，特指社交媒体的“关注者/粉丝”。
用法上，“followers of + 人/思想/宗教”强调理念或信仰层面的追随；“followers on + 平台”更偏向平台数据与受众。

summary.en: “Follower-like” means ‘like a follower’—more imitative or subordinate than leading.
summary.zh: “Follower-like”意为“像追随者一样”，更偏模仿或从属，而非领导。

definition.en: resembling a follower; acting in a way that is loyal, subordinate, or imitative rather than leading.
definition.zh: 像追随者的；表现得忠诚、从属或模仿他人，而不是带头。

examples.en: In meetings, he stays quiet and takes notes, which can seem follower-like.
examples.zh: 在会议上他总是安静做笔记，这会显得有点“追随者式”的。

examples.en: The team wanted more leadership, not a follower-like attitude.
examples.zh: 团队希望有更多领导力，而不是一种追随者式的态度。

examples.en: Her follower-like behavior made it hard for her to negotiate confidently.
examples.zh: 她那种追随者式的做法让她很难自信地谈判。

extraExplanation: “-like”是英语里很常见的后缀，意思是“像……一样/具有……的特点”，如 childlike（孩子般的）、businesslike（公事公办的）。因此 follower-like 通常表示“有追随者特征”，语气可能带一点评价色彩：暗示不够主动、缺少主见。正式写作中也常用更自然的表达，如 submissive（顺从的）、deferential（谦恭听从的）、follow-the-leader（只会跟风的，口语/形容用法）。

summary.en: “Followers” most often means people who support or pay attention to someone—especially on social media; it can also mean religious followers.
summary.zh: “followers”通常指追随/关注某人的人（尤其是社交媒体粉丝），也可指宗教信徒。

definition.en: People who choose to follow someone (a leader, teacher, celebrity, or influencer) and support, admire, or pay attention to them.
definition.zh: 追随者；拥护者（选择跟随某位领袖/老师/名人/网红并支持、仰慕或关注的人）。

examples.en: The speaker thanked her followers for their support.
examples.zh: 演讲者感谢她的追随者们的支持。

examples.en: He has millions of followers on Instagram.
examples.zh: 他在 Instagram 上有数百万粉丝。

definition.en: In a religion, people who believe in and practice the teachings of a faith or teacher.
definition.zh: （宗教）信徒；门徒（信仰并践行某宗教或某位导师教义的人）。

examples.en: The temple welcomes followers of many traditions.
examples.zh: 这座寺庙欢迎不同传统的信徒。

extraExplanation: “followers”是“follower”的复数形式。日常语境里常指社交媒体上的“粉丝/关注者”；更正式或历史语境中也可指“追随者、门徒”。
注意区分：follower（关注者/追随者）不一定是friend（朋友）。在社媒里，“followers”通常表示看到你内容的人数，而不表示现实关系亲近。

summary.en: Followership means either (1) the skill/practice of being an effective follower, or (2) the group of people who follow someone.
summary.zh: followership 指（1）有效追随与支持的能力/实践（跟随力），或（2）追随某人的人群（拥护者/粉丝群体）。

definition.en: the role, practice, or ability of being a good follower; supporting and carrying out a leader’s direction
definition.zh: 追随者的角色/实践；良好的“跟随力”：支持并执行领导者方向的能力

examples.en: Good followership means asking clarifying questions and then doing the work well.
examples.zh: 良好的跟随力意味着先提出澄清问题，然后把工作高质量地完成。

examples.en: The training program focused on both leadership and followership.
examples.zh: 这个培训项目同时强调领导力与跟随力。

definition.en: the people who follow a leader or belong to a group of supporters
definition.zh: 追随者群体；拥护者（整体）

examples.en: The coach’s followership stayed loyal even during a losing season.
examples.zh: 即使在连败的赛季里，这位教练的拥护者仍然很忠诚。

examples.en: She built a large online followership by sharing study tips.
examples.zh: 她通过分享学习技巧建立了庞大的线上粉丝群体。

extraExplanation: “followership”常见于组织管理、军队、社团等语境，用来强调：团队成功不只靠领导者，也靠成员的责任感、主动沟通与可靠执行。
在网络语境中，“followership”有时接近“粉丝群体/关注者”，但更正式；日常更常说“followers”或“fan base”。

summary.en: “followeth” is an archaic form meaning “follows.”
summary.zh: “followeth”是古体用法，意思相当于“follows（跟随/随后发生）”。

definition.en: (Archaic) third-person singular present form of “follow”; means “follows,” “comes after,” or “goes with.”
definition.zh: （古体）动词“follow”的第三人称单数现在时形式，相当于“follows”，表示“跟随、随后发生/出现、紧接着”。

examples.en: He that followeth me shall not walk in darkness.
examples.zh: 跟从我的，就不在黑暗里行走。

examples.en: Winter followeth autumn in this part of the world.
examples.zh: 在这个地区，秋天之后就是冬天。

examples.en: Trouble often followeth careless words.
examples.zh: 粗心的话语后面常常会带来麻烦。

extraExplanation: “followeth”常见于《钦定版圣经》（King James Version）等较早的英文文本。现代英语通常用“follows”。
词尾“-eth”是早期现代英语中第三人称单数现在时的一种形式（如：he speaketh=he speaks）。如今除了仿古、宗教文体或文学模仿外很少使用。

summary.en: “Following” most often means “next” or “below/coming up,” and it can also mean “a group of followers” or “the act of tracking someone.”
summary.zh: “following”最常表示“接下来的/以下的”，也可指“追随者群体”或“跟踪/跟随的行为”。

definition.en: coming after something in time, order, or position; next
definition.zh: 接下来的；随后发生的；在顺序或位置上紧接其后的

examples.en: In the following week, sales increased quickly.
examples.zh: 在接下来的那一周，销量迅速增长。

examples.en: Please read the following instructions carefully.
examples.zh: 请仔细阅读以下说明。

definition.en: a group of people who support and are interested in someone (such as an artist, leader, or influencer)
definition.zh: 追随者群体；拥趸；粉丝（支持并关注某人，如艺术家、领袖或网红的人群）

examples.en: The writer has a large following online.
examples.zh: 这位作家在网上有大量追随者。

examples.en: Her speeches gained a loyal following.
examples.zh: 她的演讲吸引了一批忠实的追随者。

definition.en: the act of going after someone or something; tracking
definition.zh: 跟随；追踪（跟在后面走或追查）

examples.en: The following of the suspect continued for hours.
examples.zh: 对嫌疑人的跟踪持续了好几个小时。

extraExplanation: “following”作形容词时很常见，尤其在书面或说明文里：the following + 名词（the following day/week/reasons），或固定搭配“the following:”表示“如下：”。
“following”作名词表示“追随者”时，通常是不可数概念（a large following），不太常说“a following person”。
注意区分“following”和“followed”：following强调“接下来/以下的（正在跟随的）”，followed更像“被跟随/之后的（已经发生过的）”，语气与语法环境不同。

summary.en: Following-day means “the next day,” especially used as an adjective before a noun (e.g., following-day delivery).
summary.zh: following-day 表示“第二天/次日”，常作形容词用于名词前（如次日送达）。

definition.en: (before a noun) happening on the next day; the day after.
definition.zh: （用于名词前）发生在第二天的；次日的。

examples.en: I got a following-day appointment with the doctor.
examples.zh: 我约到了医生的次日门诊。

examples.en: The store offers following-day delivery in some cities.
examples.zh: 这家店在一些城市提供次日送达。

definition.en: the next day; the day after (less common; often written as “the following day”).
definition.zh: 第二天；次日（较少见；更常写作 the following day）。

examples.en: We arrived late, and the following day we started work.
examples.zh: 我们到得很晚，第二天就开始工作。

examples.en: She called him the following day to apologize.
examples.zh: 她第二天打电话向他道歉。

extraExplanation: “following-day”常见于较正式或商务语境（如物流、服务承诺：following-day delivery/response）。在日常表达中，更自然的说法通常是“next-day”或直接说“the next day / the following day”。
连字符（-）多用于把两个词合在一起当作一个形容词放在名词前：following-day delivery。若放在名词后，通常不加连字符：delivery the following day。

summary.en: “Followingly” means “as what comes next; as follows,” but it’s somewhat uncommon in modern English; “as follows” is usually more natural.
summary.zh: “followingly”意为“如下；随后”，但在现代英语中较少用，通常用“as follows”更自然。

definition.en: In a way that comes next; subsequently; as what follows (often used to introduce a list or explanation).
definition.zh: 以接下来的方式；随后；如下（常用于引出列表或说明）。

examples.en: I will answer your questions followingly: first about cost, then about timing.
examples.zh: 我将如下回答你的问题：先谈费用，再谈时间。

examples.en: The steps are described followingly in the report.
examples.zh: 报告中如下描述这些步骤。

extraExplanation:
“followingly”在现代英语中比较少见，很多情况下更自然的说法是“as follows”或“in the following way”。例如：
- 更自然：“The steps are as follows …”
- 也可用：“I will explain it in the following order …”
在正式写作里，“as follows”尤其常见。

summary.en: “Followings” most commonly means groups of supporters/fans; it’s also a less common plural form used for multiple sets of “the following” items.
summary.zh: “followings”最常见指一群追随者/粉丝；也可作较少见的复数形式，表示多组“如下/以下所列”的内容。

definition.en: A group of people who support, admire, or regularly pay attention to someone or something (fans, subscribers, supporters).
definition.zh: （某人/某事的）追随者、拥护者、粉丝群体（如订阅者、支持者）。

examples.en: The singer has a huge following on social media.
examples.zh: 这位歌手在社交媒体上有庞大的粉丝群体。

examples.en: The brand built a loyal following by offering great customer service.
examples.zh: 这个品牌通过出色的客户服务培养了一批忠实拥护者。

definition.en: Plural of “following” in the sense of ‘things that follow’; often used in formal writing (e.g., “the following” meaning ‘the items listed next’).
definition.zh: “following”在“接下来/如下所列的内容”的含义下的复数形式；多见于较正式的表达。

examples.en: Please review the followings carefully: the schedule changes and the new rules.
examples.zh: 请仔细查看以下内容：日程变更和新规定。

examples.en: In formal English, people more often say “the following items” instead of “the followings.”
examples.zh: 在正式英语里，人们更常说“the following items”，而不是“the followings”。

extraExplanation: “following”更常见的用法是不可数或不加复数：a large following（很多粉丝）；the following + 名词/内容（如下/以下）。因此“followings”不算常用，除非你明确在说“多个不同的粉丝群体”或“多组如下内容”。
常见替换：fans（粉丝）、supporters（支持者）、audience（受众）、the following items（以下项目）、the points below（以下几点）。

summary.en: “Follows” means “go after,” “come next,” “obey,” “understand,” or “result from” (third-person singular present of “follow”).
summary.zh: “follows”是“follow”的一般现在时第三人称单数，可表示“跟随、接着发生、遵守、理解、由……导致”。

definition.en: (Present simple, third-person singular of “follow”) to go or come after someone or something, especially in the same direction.
definition.zh: （follow 的一般现在时第三人称单数）跟随；跟在……后面（同方向移动）。

examples.en: The dog follows me everywhere.
examples.zh: 那只狗到处都跟着我。

examples.en: Please stay close—this path is tricky, so everyone follows the guide.
examples.zh: 请走近一点——这条路不好走，所以大家都跟着向导。

definition.en: to happen after something in time or order; to come next.
definition.zh: （时间或顺序上）在……之后发生；接着发生。

examples.en: A short discussion follows the presentation.
examples.zh: 报告结束后会有一个简短的讨论。

examples.en: Winter follows fall.
examples.zh: 秋天之后是冬天。

definition.en: to obey, accept, or act according to rules, advice, or instructions.
definition.zh: 遵守；听从；按（规则/建议/指示）行事。

examples.en: She follows the safety rules at work.
examples.zh: 她在工作中遵守安全规定。

examples.en: He follows his doctor’s advice.
examples.zh: 他听从医生的建议。

definition.en: to understand or pay attention to what is being said or done.
definition.zh: 理解；听懂；跟得上（内容/思路）。

examples.en: Sorry, I didn’t follow—can you explain again?
examples.zh: 不好意思，我没听懂——你能再解释一遍吗？

examples.en: The students follow the lesson easily.
examples.zh: 学生们很容易跟上这节课。

definition.en: to result from something; to be a logical consequence.
definition.zh: 由……产生；接踵而来；是……的结果。

examples.en: It follows that we should leave early to avoid traffic.
examples.zh: 因此我们应该早点出发以避开堵车。

examples.en: If the data is wrong, errors follow.
examples.zh: 如果数据错了，错误就会随之出现。

extraExplanation: “follows”是动词“follow”的一般现在时第三人称单数形式，用于主语是he/she/it或单数名词：He follows…, The rule follows…
口语里表示“听懂/理解”时，常用否定：I don’t follow.（我没听懂/没跟上。）更礼貌可说：I’m not following—could you clarify?（我有点跟不上，能解释一下吗？）

summary.en: “Followup / follow-up” means a later action to continue or check something (noun/adj), or the act of contacting/acting again later (verb: follow up).
summary.zh: followup / follow-up 指“后续行动/跟进”（名词/形容词），也可指“再次联系或处理以推进进展”（动词：follow up）。

definition.en: a later action, call, email, or meeting done to check progress, get more information, or continue something
definition.zh: 后续行动；跟进（如后续电话、邮件或会面，用来确认进展或继续处理）

examples.en: I’ll send a followup email tomorrow to confirm the details.
examples.zh: 我明天会发一封后续邮件来确认细节。

examples.en: We scheduled a followup meeting for next week.
examples.zh: 我们安排了下周的后续会议。

definition.en: to do something again later in order to get an answer or continue dealing with a person or issue
definition.zh: 跟进；追踪处理（为得到答复或继续处理某事/某人而再次联系或采取行动）

examples.en: I’ll follow up with the client this afternoon.
examples.zh: 我今天下午会跟进那位客户。

examples.en: She followed up on the complaint to make sure it was resolved.
examples.zh: 她对那项投诉进行了跟进，以确保问题已解决。

definition.en: related to a later action that continues or checks on something
definition.zh: 后续的；跟进的（用于描述后续处理或检查的事情）

examples.en: Do you have any followup questions?
examples.zh: 你还有什么后续问题吗？

examples.en: The doctor ordered a followup test.
examples.zh: 医生安排了一个复查（后续）检查。

extraExplanation: 在写法上常见三种：follow-up（最规范、常见，尤其作名词或形容词：a follow-up email / a follow-up call）；follow up（作动词短语：to follow up with someone / on something）；followup（不带连字符的拼写也能见到，偏非正式或在商务邮件里常用）。
搭配很重要：follow up with + 人（跟进某人）；follow up on + 事（跟进某事）。

summary.en: Folly most commonly means foolish behavior or a foolish decision; it can also mean a foolish person (literary) or a decorative, impractical garden building.
summary.zh: folly最常指愚蠢的行为或决定；也可指（文学用法）愚人，或指园林中用于观赏、缺乏实用性的装饰性建筑。

definition.en: A foolish action, decision, or idea; lack of good judgment.
definition.zh: 愚蠢的行为、决定或想法；缺乏判断力。

examples.en: It was a folly to spend all his savings on a risky investment.
examples.zh: 把所有积蓄都投到高风险投资上是愚蠢之举。

examples.en: Looking back, she realized her quick decision was pure folly.
examples.zh: 回头看，她意识到自己当时的仓促决定完全是愚蠢。

definition.en: (Literary) A person who behaves in a foolish way; a fool.
definition.zh: （文学/较正式）行为愚蠢的人；傻子。

examples.en: He played the folly who ignored honest advice.
examples.zh: 他无视诚恳的建议，活像个傻子。

definition.en: (Architecture) A decorative building with little or no practical purpose, often built for beauty in gardens or estates.
definition.zh: （建筑）装饰性建筑（多用于园林/庄园），通常几乎没有实际用途，只为观赏。

examples.en: They walked past a stone folly built to look like an ancient ruin.
examples.zh: 他们走过一座石头建的装饰性建筑，被刻意设计得像古代遗迹。

examples.en: The estate’s folly became a popular spot for photos.
examples.zh: 那座庄园里的观赏性建筑成了热门拍照点。

extraExplanation: “folly”常带有较强的评价色彩，语气比一般的“mistake（错误）”更重，暗示“本可避免、却因为判断失误或冲动而做了”。
园林建筑里的“folly”在18—19世纪的英国尤其常见，贵族会在花园里建“仿古遗迹、塔楼、小庙”等，主要为了营造浪漫或古典氛围。

summary.en: “Follyer” is a rare, nonstandard noun meaning someone who acts foolishly; it’s often a misspelling of “foolier” or “follower.”
summary.zh: “follyer”是罕见的非标准名词，指做蠢事的人；很多时候其实是把“foolier”或“follower”拼错了。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) A person who behaves foolishly; someone who commits folly.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）做蠢事的人；愚行的实施者。

examples.en: In the old story, the king punished the follyer who wasted the village’s food.
examples.zh: 在那个古老的故事里，国王惩罚了那个浪费村庄食物的蠢人。

examples.en: He called himself a follyer for trusting the scam.
examples.zh: 他因为相信诈骗而称自己是个做蠢事的人。

extraExplanation:
“follyer”在现代英语里几乎不用，也不算常见的标准拼写。多数情况下，人们想写的是：
- “foolier”（更傻的）：foolish 的比较级，如 “This plan is foolier than the last one.”
- “follower”（追随者）：如 “She has many followers online.”
如果你告诉我你看到它的句子/上下文，我可以帮你判断到底是哪一个词。

summary.en: “Follying” means behaving foolishly or messing around (a rare form from the verb “folly”).
summary.zh: “Follying”指做傻事、胡闹（源自动词“folly”，较少见）。

definition.en: (present participle of “folly”) acting in a foolish or silly way; doing something that shows poor judgment.
definition.zh: （动词“folly”的现在分词）做傻事；愚蠢地行事；表现出判断力差。

examples.en: He kept follying around instead of finishing his homework.
examples.zh: 他一直在胡闹，而不是把作业完成。

examples.en: They were follying in the park, laughing too loudly for the quiet neighborhood.
examples.zh: 他们在公园里胡闹，笑得太大声，影响了安静的社区。

definition.en: (literary/rare) taking part in a “folly,” meaning a foolish action or decision.
definition.zh: （文学/少见）参与一件“愚行”（folly），指愚蠢的行为或决定。

examples.en: She later regretted follying with people who didn’t respect her.
examples.zh: 她后来后悔当初跟不尊重她的人一起做傻事。

extraExplanation: “follying”在现代英语里比较少见；更常见的是用“acting foolishly / messing around / fooling around”。
很多学习者会把“follying”看成“following”（跟随）。两者发音和意思都不同：following /ˈfɑloʊɪŋ/；follying /ˈfɑliɪŋ/。
“folly”更常用作名词，表示“愚蠢的行为/决定”（例如：It was a folly to trust him.）。

summary.en: Follyproof (rare) means designed to prevent foolish mistakes; often used like foolproof.
summary.zh: Follyproof（罕见）指“防止愚蠢错误的”；常被当作 foolproof 的一种写法或创造性表达。

definition.en: (Rare) Designed to prevent foolish mistakes; not easily spoiled by someone’s poor judgment.
definition.zh: （罕见）为防止愚蠢错误而设计的；不容易因判断失误而搞砸。

examples.en: The checklist is meant to be follyproof, so even a tired worker won’t miss a step.
examples.zh: 这份清单旨在做到“防蠢”（follyproof），这样即使工人很累也不会漏掉步骤。

examples.en: They tried to build a follyproof process, but people still found a way around it.
examples.zh: 他们试图建立一个“防蠢”的流程，但人们还是找到了绕开的办法。

extraExplanation: “follyproof”不是常见英语词，更常见、自然的说法是“foolproof”（意为“万无一失的 / 不易出错的”）。如果你在文章里看到“follyproof”，多半是作者的创造性用词、幽默表达，或是把“foolproof”写错了。
词根提示：folly = 愚蠢的行为/愚行；-proof = “可抵御……的 / 不受……影响的”。组合起来就是“能抵御愚行带来错误的”。

summary.en: Folsom is most commonly a proper name: a city in Northern California; it can also refer to Folsom State Prison or be a surname.
summary.zh: Folsom常见为专有名词：加州北部的一座城市；也可指福尔瑟姆州立监狱，或作为姓氏使用。

definition.en: A city in Northern California (near Sacramento), known for Folsom Lake and a historic role in the Gold Rush era.
definition.zh: （美国）加利福尼亚州北部的一座城市（靠近萨克拉门托），以福尔瑟姆湖闻名，并与淘金热时期的历史有关。

examples.en: We spent the weekend biking around Folsom Lake.
examples.zh: 我们周末去福尔瑟姆湖附近骑行了。

examples.en: Folsom is a suburb of Sacramento with many tech jobs.
examples.zh: 福尔瑟姆是萨克拉门托附近的郊区，有不少科技类工作机会。

definition.en: Short for Folsom State Prison, a well-known California prison located in the area.
definition.zh: （常指）福尔瑟姆州立监狱，加州一座很有名的监狱，位于当地。

examples.en: The documentary discussed life inside Folsom.
examples.zh: 那部纪录片讨论了福尔瑟姆监狱里的生活。

examples.en: He mentioned visiting Folsom State Prison on a history tour.
examples.zh: 他提到在历史之旅中参观了福尔瑟姆州立监狱。

definition.en: A family name (surname).
definition.zh: 一个姓氏。

examples.en: Dr. Folsom will see you now.
examples.zh: 福尔瑟姆医生现在可以为您看诊了。

extraExplanation: “Folsom”在美国文化里常让人联想到两件事：一是加州的福尔瑟姆州立监狱；二是歌手Johnny Cash的现场专辑《At Folsom Prison》（1968），以及歌曲《Folsom Prison Blues》。因此在阅读或听到“Folsom”时，要根据上下文判断是城市、监狱还是姓氏。
